title: Looking for similar font
content:
Any ideas on similar fonts to “Quixote”? ( [www.textaxis.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.textaxis.com/ "www.textaxis.com"))

 [‹ Mirror or Archive of linesandsplines.com?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33564 "Go to previous forum topic") [What interests you most about Opentype? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33089 "Go to next forum topic")
author: frode frank

comments.content:
Adobe Garamond

_or_ not very similar but you may like [Leitura News](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.dstype.com/) by [Dino dos Santos](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Dino%252Bdos%252BSantos)
With the alternates? Edit: Jeah! Thanks:)

Yes, there are some similar swash alternates in [Adobe Garamond Expert](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/creative_alliance/adobe_garamond_expert_collection/). Though I recommend getting the OpenType [Adobe Garamond Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=Adobe%20Garamond%20Pro) for much easier use.
[Sabon Next](http://web.archive.org/web/20080103050647/http:/www.linotype.com/53159/sabonnext-family.html) might also be an option. It also has all kinds of swash chars.
Adobe Caslon has the swashes too.
